intro: Stachytarpheta robinsoniana, commonly known as the red-stemmed ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as riverbanks and open woodlands. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils make it a common weed in tropical regions.
